value.description: Body systems, anatomic locations or regions, and body sites
value.examples: arm, knee, abdomen, nose, liver, head, respiratory system, lymphocytes

value.description: All age terms and phrases, including ones for patients, family members, and others
value.examples: 40-year-old, 51 yo, 3 months old, adult, infant, elderly, young, minor, middle-aged

value.description: Terms that disclose the gender of the subject
value.examples: male, female, woman, gentleman, lady

value.description: Phrases that indicate the ethnicity of the subject
value.examples: African American, Asian

value.description: Diagnostic procedures and tests, including vital signs and body measurements
value.examples: MRI, ECG, HIV test, hemoglobin, platelets count, scale systems such as Bristol stool scale

value.description: Full date relating to a medical condition, examination, treatment, medication, or administrative event
value.examples: May 11th

value.description: Directional terms that may relate to a body structure, medical condition, examination, or treatment
value.examples: left, lateral, upper, posterior

value.description: how often a medical condition, examination, treatment, or medication occurred, occurs, or should occur
value.examples: usually

value.description: The value related to an examination or a medical condition measurement
The unit of measurement related to an examination or a medical condition measurement
value.examples: cm

value.description: Phrases that express the quantitative relation between an entity and some additional information
Temporal terms relating to the beginning and/or length (duration) of a medical condition, examination, treatment, medication, or administrative event
Description of a change in another entity over time, such as condition progression / a course of treatment or medication
value.examples: improvement, worsening, resolution, remission, increase in medication dosage

value.description: All mentions of names and symbols of human genes as well as chromosomes and parts of chromosomes and proteins
value.examples: MTRR, F2

value.description: All mentions of gene variations and mutations
Gene expression level
value.examples: positive for-, negative for-, overexpressed, detected in high/low levels, elevated

value.description: MTRR, F2
value.examples: trisomy, germline mutation, loss of function

value.description: Events that relate to the healthcare system but of an administrative/semi-administrative nature
value.examples: registration, admission, trial, study entry, transfer, discharge, hospitalization, hospital stay

value.description: registration, admission, trial, study entry, transfer, discharge, hospitalization, hospital stay
value.examples: emergency room, physician’s office, cardio unit, hospice, hospital

value.description: emergency room, physician’s office, cardio unit, hospice, hospital
value.examples: dentist, pathologist, neurologist, radiologist, pharmacist, nutritionist, physical therapist, chiropractor

value.description: Disease, syndrome, poisoning
value.examples: breast cancer, Alzheimer’s, HTN, CHF, spinal cord injury

value.description: Subjective or objective evidence of disease or other diagnoses
value.examples: chest pain, headache, dizziness, rash, SOB, abdomen was soft, good bowel sounds, well nourished

value.description: Qualitative terms that are used to describe a medical condition
value.examples: sudden, acute, chronic, longstanding, burning, sharp, severe, mild, a bit, uncontrolled, local, focal, diffuse

value.description: Qualitative terms that characterize the condition by a scale, which is a finite ordered list of values
value.examples: stage III

value.description: A set of medications that have a similar mechanism of action, a related mode of action, a similar chemical structure, and/or are used to treat the same disease
value.examples: ACE inhibitor, opioid, antibiotics, pain relievers

value.description: Medication mentions, including copyrighted brand names, and non-brand names
value.examples: Ibuprofen

value.description: Amount of medication ordered
value.examples: Infuse Sodium Chloride solution 1000 mL

value.description: The form of the medication
value.examples: solution, pill, capsule, tablet, patch, gel, paste, foam, spray, drops, cream, syrup

value.description: The administration method of medication
value.examples: oral, topical, inhaled

value.description: Mentions of family relatives of the subject
value.examples: father, daughter, siblings, parents

value.description: Therapeutic procedures
value.examples: knee replacement surgery, bone marrow transplant, TAVI, diet

value.description: an antigen triggering an allergic reaction
value.examples: cats, peanuts

value.description: Mentions of employment status including specific profession
value.examples: unemployed, retired, firefighter, student

value.description: Mentions of the housing situation
value.examples: homeless, living with parents, living alone, living with others

value.description: Mentions of use of legal or illegal drugs, tobacco or alcohol
value.examples: smoking, drinking, or heroin

value.description: Mentions of specific amounts of substance use
value.examples: a pack (of cigarettes) or a few glasses (of wine)
